title: Addressing the Threat Posed by Applications and Other Software Developed or Controlled by Chinese Companies

enrichment.summary: This executive order bans certain software applications developed or controlled by Chinese companies from U.S. transactions to protect national security by preventing unauthorized data collection on Americans. It directs the Secretary of Commerce to identify risky apps and implement prohibitions to stop foreign adversaries from accessing sensitive U.S. user data.
potential_concerns: The ban on transactions with certain Chinese software could lead to retaliation or escalation in economic and technological conflict with China.
The order may be challenging to enforce effectively due to the widespread use of mobile applications and the complexity of tracking indirect transactions.
There could be negative impacts on users who rely on these applications for legitimate purposes, including businesses and individuals.
Implementation relies heavily on interagency coordination which could delay timely updates to the prohibited list of software.
The order may raise questions about due process and the criteria used to designate apps as national security risks.
